revised_title: Hypocycloid Cavity Morphology and Energy Variation Theorem
tldr: The author presents an analytic proof of the energy variation theorem, which states that a cusp-shaped hypocycloid cavity can evolve through mass-conserved shape changes without an associated energy barrier. This process leads to the continuous decrease of strain energy and surface energy as the cavity transforms from a perfectly circular hole to a hypocycloid cusp crack. The study provides a unified model of diffusive crack formation, connecting the Griffith model to cycloid surfaces and offering insights into crack initiation processes.
